features: 【Perfect Gifts for Him】The perfect combination of stylish design, and feature-packed, our Blood Pressure Watch is the ultimate solution to keeping your health in check and decorating with your own style. They cater to everyone's needs and are thoughtful birthday gifts for men, friends, family, and elders.Blood Pressure Watch

【Receive and Dial Call】this blood pressure watch Christmas gifts for men comes with a built-in phone function. You can make and receive calls directly on your fitness watch without taking out your phone. This way, you can stay connected while exercising outdoors, driving, or on the go without interrupting your blood pressure monitoring.

【24/7 Heart Rate Monitoring】Equipped with a high-precision PPG sensor, this blood pressure watch gifts for husband tracks your heart rate around the clock. It also saves your resting heart rate data to monitor long-term changes. Additionally, the blood oxygen level is measured using a reflective-light-based sensor, helping you train your breath to calm down.

【Intelligent Fitness Companion】Take your training to the next level with this feature-packed fitness tracker watch men birthday gift ideas. It supports 100 professional fitness modes, including yoga and HIT. With accurate monitoring and analysis of data points like blood pressure, steps, and calories burned, this watch Christmas gifts for men is compatible with both iPhone and Android devices.

【Long battery Life】The smartwatch adopts efficient battery management technology and has a long battery life, so you don’t need to charge frequently and can better enjoy the convenience brought by the Blood Pressure Watch.

【Express Your Style】With a sleek 2" touch screen and a sturdy, anti-scratch frame, the Brilliant Black fitness tracker blood pressure watch gifts for boyfriend offers a stylish and elegant design. Choose from 5 dials or explore over 200+ trendsetting dials within the app. Create and customize your own smart watch faces using photos from your phone gallery.Blood Pressure Watch

【Stay Connected】Sync this Blood Pressure Watch smartwatch with your smartphone to receive call, SMS, and SNS notifications, including Facebook, Twitter, WhatsApp, Linkedin, and more. Get vibration alerts on your watch for messages, calls, and app notifications. You can even answer/make calls directly from the blood pressure watch.

【Perfect Travel Partner】Capture precious memories effortlessly by using your blood pressure watch to control your smartphone camera with a wave of your hand. This heart rate monitor watch gifts for him is a great travel companion, providing 5-day weather forecasting to help you plan your daily travel routes with ease.Blood Pressure Watch

【Visual Health Reporting】Through the connection with the Da Fit app, you can view personalized health reports at any time to understand your blood pressure trends and changes in other health indicators.Blood Pressure Watch

【Comfortable Wearing Experience】Our Christmas gifts for men Blood Pressure Watch is designed with lightweight materials and equipped with a soft strap, which makes you feel comfortable when wearing it and will not put any burden on your wrist.Blood Pressure Watch

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This smart watch has exceeded my expectations so far. There is no monthly charge for it. It syncs great with my I phone. Blood pressure reading is only a couple points off from what my arm cuff reads. It is easier to see incoming texts than my phone is because I can see them without having to take my gloves off. The charge so far lasts 4 days before needing re-charged. The phone speaker works great too. I would buy this again, but hopefully won't have to for a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: All things considered, I really love this watch and I wear it almost every day. I love the tactical look of it and it pairs well with my work uniform. The strap is adjustable and comfortable. The instructions were easy to use and the app was simple to download and understand.My favorite features include the smoothness of the user interface, the user-friendliness, its ability to check your heart rate and how many steps you've walked, and to track your sleeping patters. That being said, I have run into a few issues.Firstly, the strap gets really sweaty on my wrist. I suspect it's because of the material it's created from, which feels similar to rubber. Maybe I am sensitive to the material and that is what is causing my wrist to get so sweaty after wearing it for the day but it's definitely a bit frustrating. The strap is detachable though,. so if I want to replace it with a different strap I should be able to.Secondly, the functionality of the messaging system is lacking. I am only able to view a text message and delete it. I cannot respond to a text from the watch. I have not tried out the call feature.Thirdly, you cannot disconnect the watch from your bluetooth if you want it to continue taking your vitals and steps, but you HAVE to disconnect it from the bluetooth if you don't want everything you play on your phone to be routed to the watch instead. This is the biggest downfall to me about this watch. If I forget to disconnect my watch from my phone and I'm watching youtube or started a phone call, the sound will go through the watch instead of my phone, even without the dial feature set up.For this I'm giving it four stars. I love the watch otherwise, and these things may not bother other people but they bother me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good Watch but Not WaterProff, Blood Pressure Monitor off by 50 digits, Voice Command Dont work.
reviews.reviewText: I dont like that the Blood Pressure is off by 50 Digits, Went in the Pool stop working not WaterProff and Tap and Spect Voice command dont work.I do like talking threw my watch making phone calls so i dont have to pull out my phone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome value and stylish watch!
reviews.reviewText: I picked this because it has blood pressure sensor in it. My very expensive fitness watch doesn't have that and I'm getting ready for a long trip coming up next year and I'd really like to have a blood pressure monitor with me. (I'm weird about my numbers.)I decided to give this a try to see how it would do.I got to say, I'm blown away with what all they packed into this watch at a very modest price. Getting it synced with my Apple phone was very straight forward. The screen is very clear and bright. However, it is worth noting the screen goes black after so many seconds and you have to wake it up when you want to see it. (Not really a big deal, but if this is a deal breaker for you, now you know.)The touch screen on this is very responsive. Beside just flipping through the screens there's an on screen calculator and you can even dial numbers right from from the watch face. When you dial a number you can even talk into the watch and hear the other person right on your wrist. While not super loud I was able to clearly hear my wife on a test call. She said my voice sounded loud and clear to her.I have no doubt this is waterproof as promised. I wore it over the course of several days and never took it off even when in the shower. However, the shower did mess with the touch screen.I took this for a run on my treadmill and after about an hour of jogging it was off by about a 10th of a mile. It read 5.76 miles when I'd actually only gone about 5.66 miles. I'd say that is reasonably accurate.Blood pressure monitor was consistently low by about 4 to 5. The watch would read me about 104/66 when my blood pressure was actually closer to 108/70. I can live with that though as long as I know it is consistent. Which it is.Battery life was easily over a week.This is probably not geared towards fitness as much as I'd actually use on regular basis. For example when I went for a run it didn't tell me my pace. Just how long and far I'd run. I know with that I can figure out my pace, but it is a small ask to want the watch to just have this built in. I suppose to be fair to this point I'm a runner and triathlete. So, I'm probably not the target audience for this watch. I would guess this is for the average Joe, or Jane, that is looking for an inexpensive smart watch that can also help them keep track of their health.All and all, I think this is an awesome value! It won't replace my fitness watch, but I'll definitely be taking this along next year for the blood pressure monitor feature.Happy to give this one 5 out of 5 stars!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Has some great features
reviews.reviewText: I understand the disclaimers and I am not expecting this to be a medical grade product. With that being said, the functions on this watch are great! There are a few quirks on the app. Had a bit of trouble getting it to accept the birthdate and weight. But I got it working. I wish that you could pair it on two devices simultaneously. That would be an excellent help in our situation. My husband enjoys keeping an eye on his status. While I need to be able to keep an eye on his blood pressure. When the watch is paired with my phone, I can quickly check his BP while he is anywhere in the house. Without going into details, suffice it to say that this is huge, even if it was not an exact reading. The other functions are helpful as well. Of course the stips, and heart rate. But there are some wellness things included that are fun from time to time. The display on the app is very easy to read. This watch is a great value. It looks nice on his arm, and the band will fit most. It is a soft silicone and comfortable to wear. There are clock face choices and we found several that he likes.
